title: Project Runway
overview: Experience Lifetime’s Emmy-nominated reality-competition series like never before as Project Runway enters its 12th and most interactive season yet. A series first, fans can share their reactions in real time to story lines, challenges and decisions through the new on-screen feature, PlayRunway. Plus, seven super fans will be featured in an episode for a makeover, a mystery contestant from a past season, chosen by fans, will be unveiled as the 16th designer for the season and, as requested by fans, more Tim Gunn! Gunn will join host Heidi Klum and the judges to watch the runway show, answer questions about what transpired in the workroom and give them an opportunity to examine the workmanship of each design. Join celebrity guest judges, including Kate Bosworth and Sigourney Weaver, as designers compete for a prize package worth more than half a million dollars.

episodes.title: Sky's the Limit
episodes.overview: In the Season 12 opener, the designers fly high when they arrive on an airport runway and then must create looks from parachute materials.

episodes.title: An Unconventional Coney Island
episodes.overview: The clothiers are directed to Coney Island for an unconventional-materials challenge that involves playing carnival games. Kelly Osbourne is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Tie the Knot
episodes.overview: Bow ties are the centerpiece when the designers craft looks. Guest judge: Jesse Tyler Ferguson.

episodes.title: YOU Choose Your Materials!
episodes.overview: It's the ultimate unconventional challenge when the designers are split into small teams to create a luxurious mini collection inspired by items from four completely varied retailers. Fashion designer June Ambrose serves as a guest judge.

episodes.title: Let's Go Glamping!
episodes.overview: The designers have a chance to wind down and go on an overnight "glamping" trip, with the surroundings from the campsite serving as inspiration for the designer's next challenge. But could one designer's lack of love for the outdoors derail him? Actress Allison Williams of Girls serves as guest judge.

episodes.title: Shoes First!
episodes.overview: Shoes inspire garments. Included: a shocking elimination. The guest judges are Kaley Cuoco ("The Big Bang Theory") and style editor Anne Fulenwider.

episodes.title: Having a Field Day
episodes.overview: The designers compete in field day events for extra work time; the designers must create high-end performance wear for Heidi Klum's New Balance line.

episodes.title: Let's Do Brunch
episodes.overview: The remaining designers fashion spirited looks for modern Southern women. The guest judges are Stacy Keibler and John Thomas.

episodes.title: Project Runway SuperFan!
episodes.overview: The designers are inspired by the show's biggest fans, who receive makeovers and garments crafted specifically for them. Designer Erin Fetherston is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Next Generation...
episodes.overview: Young, innovative folks inspire the designers. Guest judge: Peter Som.

episodes.title: There Is No I in Team
episodes.overview: Season 11 opens with 16 designers arriving in New York City. They use the Big Apple as an inspiration to create clothes, and soon discover they will be working in teams the entire season.

episodes.title: Spin Out
episodes.overview: The designers serve up ball-boy outfits and new server uniforms for a Ping-Pong social club.

episodes.title: Surprise Me
episodes.overview: The contestants are tasked to design garments for host Heidi Klum for the launch of her new fragrance line. Heidi will wear the winning garments in her national commercial and a second winning garment for a press event.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Hard And Soft
episodes.overview: While the teams get a twist, the designers also get a blast from the past when two unconventional challenges are merged into one for their newest challenge--creating a line out of hard and soft materials from the flower shop and hardware store.

episodes.title: A Little Bit Country, A Little Bit Rock And Roll
episodes.overview: The designers are separated into teams of two to create a performance outfit and a red-carpet look for country artist Miranda Lambert, who is also the guest judge.

episodes.title: Senior Fling
episodes.overview: Fashionable clothes for senior citizens are created by the contestants.

episodes.title: A Sticky Situation
episodes.overview: The contestants design fashion-forward prom looks constructed from duct tape.

episodes.title: Take It All Off!
episodes.overview: The contestants design outfits for the male revue Australia's Thunder from Down Under.

episodes.title: He Said, She Said
episodes.overview: For this episode, the designers are instructed to draw inspiration from Lord & Taylor’s signature “American Beauty Rose” and create a design with the retailer’s customer in mind.

episodes.title: Europe, Here We Come
episodes.overview: The designers travel to Berlin, Barcelona, London and Paris to get inspiration for the final challenge before the finale.

episodes.title: Finale: Part 1
episodes.overview: The finalists work on their collections; Tim Gunn visits each of the finalists in their hometown.

episodes.title: Finale: Part 2
episodes.overview: The designers show their collections in the final runway show at Lincoln Center; Michael Kors returns as a guest judge to help choose the winner.

episodes.title: A Times Square Anniversary Party
episodes.overview:
The 16 contestants were tasked to create complimentary outfits with one designed at home and the other designed at Parsons with a budget of $100. The first runway challenge was held outdoors at Times Square.

Guest Judges: Patricia Field and Lauren Graham

episodes.title: Candy Couture
episodes.overview:
The second challenge will be the unconventional challenge where the designers will have to make outfits out of candy from Dylan's Candy Bar.

Dylan Lauren guest judges.

episodes.title: Welcome Back (or not) to the Runway
episodes.overview: The clothiers spin out designs for the Emmy Awards, with former contestants returning to serve as their clients.

episodes.title: Women on the Go
episodes.overview: In another team challenge the designers have to create cohesive looks for women at work. Marie Claire magazine's Editor in Chief Joanna Coles is the guest judge.

episodes.title: It's My Way on The Runway
episodes.overview: A team challenge tasks the clothiers with stitching together cohesive looks for working women. Joanna Coles is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Fix My Friend
episodes.overview: The clothiers create looks to accompany new hairstyles for women who are in need of makeovers. British fashion designer Alice Temperley serves as the guest judge.

episodes.title: Oh My Lord and Taylor
episodes.overview: The designers compete to have their looks selected as part of a 10-piece capsule collection. Fashion executive Bonnie Brooks is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Starving Artist
episodes.overview: In a sales-based test, the clothiers are tasked to sell their goods to folks on the street. They must also spin out fall looks. Designer Anna Sui is the guest judge.

episodes.title: It's All About Me
episodes.overview: The designers create their own fabric for their looks and receive visits from their family. Former contestants Anya Ayoung-Chee and Mondo Guerra return to guest judge.

episodes.title: I Get a Kick Out of Fashion
episodes.overview: The designers try to get a leg up in the competition when they visit Radio City Music Hall and create costumes for the legendary Rockettes. Debra Messing is the guest judge.

episodes.title: It's Fashion Baby
episodes.overview: The designers create fashions for babies. Hilary Duff is the guest judge.

episodes.title: In A Place Far, Far Away
episodes.overview: The designers are taken to a grand location for inspiration to create avant-garde looks. Actress Zoe Saldana is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: In the wake of their hometown visits with Tim Gunn, the final four designers land back in New York City to present three looks to the judges in their bid to score a coveted fashion-week spot.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: The winning designer is named in the conclusion of the two-part Season 10 finale. Before that, the still-standing contestants battle to be best-in-sew by showcasing their Fashion Week collections. Jennifer Hudson is the guest judge.

episodes.title: Come As You Are
episodes.overview: Season 9 of the fashion-themed reality series kicks off.

episodes.title: My Pet Project
episodes.overview: The designers will work with unconventional materials bought from a pet shop. They can use everything from bird seed to hamster bedding and training pads.

episodes.title: Go Big or Go Home
episodes.overview: The designers will work in teams of two to create looks larger than life. Their creations will be worn by professional stilt walkers in an first ever outdoor runway walk.

episodes.title: All About Nina
episodes.overview: The designers quickly realize they are in for a tough challenge when it is revealed that Nina Garcia is their client! The stakes are raised when Nina tells them she will wear the winning look to an important industry event. Marie Claire's editor-in-chief, Joanna Coles and Actress Kerry Washington serve as the guest judges.

episodes.title: Off The Track
episodes.overview: The designers wake up to find New Balance clothing set out for them and are instructed to put it on and meet Heidi and Tim at a track and field center to hear about the latest challenge.  There they learn they will be competing in teams to design a piece inspired by Heidi Klum for New Balance sneakers but in order to be crowned team captain, they must win a different kind of race-on foot! Erin Wasson serves as guest judge.

episodes.title: Art of the Matter
episodes.overview: The designers become students for a day when they are partnered with art students from the Harlem School of the Arts to create a piece of art that will serve as the inspiration for their next garment. Kenneth Cole serves as guest judge,

episodes.title: Can't We All Just Get Along?
episodes.overview: To the delight of the designers, the HP Create Your Own Fabric Challenge is back - with a twist! With the use of an HP Touchsmart, designers will work in two teams of five to create a cohesive collection. Armed with HP video cameras, they head our into the city to tell the story of what truly inspires them.

episodes.title: What Women Want
episodes.overview: When Heidi introduces nine men on the runway, the designers are stunned. But they quickly breathe a sigh of relief when Tim reveals that the men are not their models - they will be designing for their significant others! Actress Malin Akerman serves as guest judge.

episodes.title: Image is Everything
episodes.overview: The designers are treated to a special performance from their new client, an up-and-coming band. Broken into two teams of four, the designers are charged with creating a look that will establish them as image-makers.

episodes.title: Sew 70s
episodes.overview: Create a modern look inspired by 70s fashion. Guest judge: Olivia Palermo

episodes.title: This is for the Birds
episodes.overview: Exotic Birds serve as the inspiration for this week;s LlOreal Challenge. The designers must really step up their game when Tim reveals that during judging they will go head-to-head with one other designer putting one in the top and one in the bottom during judging. Francisco Costa serves as guest judge for this challenge.

episodes.title: The Finale Challenge
episodes.overview: The judges want to see their visions as designers so they challenge the contestants to create a mini-collection. Actress Zoe Saldana serves as guest judge.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: Tim Gunn travels to the homes of the finalists to check on their progress.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: The designers prepare to show at fashion week; an intense debate arises at the final judging.

episodes.title: Tim Gunn: Behind the Seams of Season 9
episodes.overview: For our Project Runway fans who just can't get enough, we will wrap up Season 9 with a bang! Beloved mentor, Tim Gunn will reveal some of the show's biggest secrets and give audiences his unedited thoughts. This special is an unprecedented look back at one of the most memorable seasons to date.

episodes.title: And Sew It Begins
episodes.overview: 17 designers start a new season to reach New York Fashion Week and become the winner. The designers were asked to incorporate an article of clothing taken from another designer's suitcase into a new design of their own in just five hours.

episodes.title: Larger than Life
episodes.overview: The designers have to create a fashion forward outfit representing strong and practical Marie Claire Women. The winning design will be displayed on a 40 foot tall billboard in Times Square.

episodes.title: It's a Party
episodes.overview: The designers have to create an outfit from materials from a party supplies store. The winning designer will get immunity for next challenge.

episodes.title: Hats Off To You
episodes.overview: In this episode the designers must design an outfit that compliments the famous Philip Treacy's beautiful artistic hats.

episodes.title: There IS an 'I' in Team
episodes.overview: The designers are divided in two teams of six, where they have to design a trendy six piece collection for fall 2010. The teams are asked to choose a concept and a textile as the core of their collection.

episodes.title: You Can Totally Wear That Again
episodes.overview: The 11 remaining designers must create a fashionable look from a bridesmaid dress.

episodes.title: What's Mine is Yours
episodes.overview: The remaining designers make waves when series judge Michael Kors assigns them to create resort attire.

episodes.title: A Rough Day on the Runway
episodes.overview: The designers are hemmed in by the politics of fashion when they delve into American sportswear.

episodes.title: Race to the Finish
episodes.overview: The designers must create a high-fashion look and a ready-to-wear companion piece to appear in a L'Oreal Paris ad.

episodes.title: There's a Pattern Here
episodes.overview: The designers design a fabric for their look that was inspired by a moment from their past.

episodes.title: A Look in the Line
episodes.overview: The designers must create three looks appropriate for Heidi Klum's activewear collection. The winner of the challenge has his or her designs manufactured and sold on Amazon.com.

episodes.title: We're in a New York State of Mind
episodes.overview: The challenge is to create a look inspired by New York City. The final five designers compete to see who will move on to create their collections for the chance to show at New York Fashion Week.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: In Part 1 of the two-part Season 8 finale, mentor Tim Gunn visits the four remaining designers in their hometowns to review the progress of their collections.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: The thread of Season 8 episodes ends in the conclusion of the finale, which irons out the style trials and reveals the winning clothier

episodes.title: Back to New York
episodes.overview: Season 7 of Project Runway premieres with sixteen new designers, who will try to make their way to Bryant Park to show their collections in New York Fashion Week. The show returns to New York and the contestants will be living at the Atlas Apartments and working in Parsons work room.

episodes.title: The Fashion Farm
episodes.overview: The designers must create a party look from a burlap potato sack.

episodes.title: The Hi's and Lows of Fashion
episodes.overview: The designers must create a high-end signature look and a look-for-less inspired by another team’s design.

episodes.title: Design Your Heart Out
episodes.overview: The designers must create a signature dress for the Campbell’s AdDRESS Your Heart program.

episodes.title: Run for Cover
episodes.overview: The designers must create a look to be worn by Heidi Klum on the cover of Marie Claire.

episodes.title: A Little Bit of Fashion
episodes.overview: The designers have to think small this week as they design an outfit for a child model. Later they are told that they also have to design a companion outfit for their adult models.

episodes.title: Hard Wear
episodes.overview: Halfway through the competition the designers get the task to create an unconventional, innovative look and an accessory from materials from a hardware store. The limited budget makes a contender to resize his design.

episodes.title: The Elements of Fashion
episodes.overview: Halfway through the competition the designers get the task to create an unconventional, innovative look and an accessory from materials from a hardware store. The limited budget makes a contender to resize his design.

episodes.title: Takin' It To The Streets
episodes.overview: The designers have to find their inspirations in the streets of New York. Working in teams of two they are visiting Harlem, Upper East Side, Chinatown and East Village to find ideas for creating a day look and an evening look.

episodes.title: Hey, That's My Fabric
episodes.overview: The designers face a new task that has never been done on any season of the show: The must create their own looks with their own digitally printed fabric that they created themselves.

episodes.title: Sew Much Pressure
episodes.overview: The remaining contestants must craft designs for a celebrity.

episodes.title: The Big, Top Designers
episodes.overview: It'll be like a three-ring circus when the designers create garb as inspired by the big top. The stakes are high, too: The challenge determines which clothiers will advance to Fashion Week.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: Three finalists prepare their collections for Bryant Park.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: The three finalists finish preparing their collections and show them at Bryant Park.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.overview: Nina Garcia and Tim Gunn host this special reunion show with the designers and models from season seven of Project Runway

episodes.title: Welcome to Los Angeles
episodes.overview:
Designers must create a red carpet look showing innovation and point of view.

Lindsay Lohan as guest judge.

episodes.title: We Expect Fashion
episodes.overview: The remaining designers have to create a look for an actual celebrity, but there is a twist involved, which will be a big surprise for the designers.

episodes.title: Rumble on the Runway
episodes.overview: The designers are taken to the beach and have to create a fun and fashionable surfwear look inspired by Californian surfwear. They have to work in teams of two. Later on Tim Gunn declares that the designers have to create an avant-garde companion piece.

episodes.title: What a Woman Wants
episodes.overview: The thirteen remaining designers have new clients for this week's challenge- their models! They must create an eye-catching look to be worn at a fashion industry event, and have only one day and with a budget of just one hundred dollars to make it work.

episodes.title: Fashion Headliners
episodes.overview: Twelve designers use newspaper as fabric to create their looks, but one designer becomes frustrated and finally has to go home.

episodes.title: Lights, Camera, Sew!
episodes.overview: Designers have to create outfits for film genres like film noir, western, period piece, sci-fi and action & adventure. The make-up of the models has to match the characters, they are representing. This one-day challenge will have a surprising elimination result.

episodes.title: The Sky is the Limit
episodes.overview: The designers, working in pairs, have to create two looks for Macy's INC brand using blue fabrics. The winning designer will actually create a summer dress to be sold in Macy's stores.

episodes.title: A Fashionable New Beginning
episodes.overview: Designers have to reconstruct wedding gowns of newly divorced women into fashionable new looks. In this one day challenge one designer will win immunity for the last time in this season.

episodes.title: Sequins, Feathers and Fur, Oh My!
episodes.overview: Christina Aguilera is a guest judge in this episode and the designers have to create an extravagant stage look for her, which should catch the attention of the audience from far away and should also look chic on video from very close.

episodes.title: Around the World in Two Days
episodes.overview: In this one day challenge the designers have to take inspiration from seven famous locations in the world chosen by fashion designer Michael Kors. At the end of the challenge only six designers will be left heading to Bryant Park.

episodes.title: Let's Start From The Beginning
episodes.overview: The 16 new designers are introduced and their first challenge: making clothing out of unusual sources.

episodes.title: Grass is Always Greener
episodes.overview: The contestants are forced to expand and purify their thinking by "going green" with the help of their models.

episodes.title: Bright Lights, Big City
episodes.overview: The remaining designers are inspired by New York's night life for their new creations.

episodes.title: Rings of Glory
episodes.overview: Short track speed skating five-time Olympic medalist and 2007 Dancing with the Stars winner Apolo Anton Ohno is guest judge. Inspired by his wins, the designers have to create sport outfits for the Olympic Games.

episodes.title: Welcome to the Jungle
episodes.overview: Inspired by her role on Lipstick Jungle, Brooke Shields guest judges as the designers must create outfits for the working woman.

episodes.title: Good Queen Fun
episodes.overview: The designers were asked to make an outfit for a drag queen. Chris March of Season 4 made a guest appearance to deliver the challenge. The designers were picked at random to they select which drag queen to work with. They were given $200 to shop for supplies and two days to complete their designs. The winner received immunity for the next challenge. The designers' models were not used in this challenge. Designers and Drag Queens:         * Blayne with Miss Understood         * Daniel with Annida Greenkard         * Jerrell with LeMay         * Joe with Varla Jean Merman         * Keith with Sherry Vine         * Kenley with Farrah Moans         * Korto with Sweetie         * Leanne with Sharon Needles         * Stella with Luisa Verde         * Suede with Hedda Lettuce         * Terri with Acid Betty     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Nina Garcia, Michael Kors     * Guest Judge: RuPaul

episodes.title: Fashion That Drives You
episodes.overview: The designers were required to make an outfit made entirely out of the spare parts and raw materials from a Saturn hybrid car. They were told to walk to 142 West 31st Street in Manhattan. After taking an elevator to the roof of the building, they were instructed to collect as much of the recycled car parts from within the parked Saturn vehicles. They had four minutes to collect the materials and one day to complete their outfits. The winner received immunity for the next challenge.     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Michael Kors     * Guest judges: Laura Bennett (sitting in for Nina Garcia), Rachel Zoe

episodes.title: Double 0 Fashion
episodes.overview: The designers were taken to the Meatpacking District and brought to the offices and design showroom of living fashion legend and current CFDA president, designer Diane von Furstenberg. Their challenge was to create a look for her Fall 2008 collection inspired by the movie, A Foreign Affair, starring screen legend, Marlene Dietrich. They were given free rein and 15 minutes inside Diane von Furstenburg's fabric sample room to select fabrics for their designs. The winning garment will be produced in limited quantities and exclusively sold to American Express cardholders, with proceeds going to the CFDA Foundation. The winner did not receive immunity for the next challenge.     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Michael Kors     * Guest judge: Fern Mallis (sitting in for Nina Garcia), Diane von Furstenberg

episodes.title: What's Your Sign?
episodes.overview: The designers team up in pairs with eliminated designers to create an avant-garde garment around one of the two astrological signs of their group. They had one day and 8 hours to complete the look. The night before the runway, they were brought to the American Museum of Natural History in New York. There the designers were greeted with surprise guest appearances of former Project Runway designers and winners Kara Janx, Alison Kelly, Jay McCarroll, Robert Plotkin, Christian Siriano, Daniel Vosovic, & Carmen Webber, who all voted on a winning look. This episode featured a surprise double elimination & the winner no longer had the advantage of immunity going forward. Teams:         * Blayne and Stella (Libra)         * Jerell and Jennifer (Sagittarius)         * Joe and Daniel (Aries)         * Kenley and Wesley (Aquarius)         * Korto and Kelli (Aquarius)         * Leanne and Emily (Scorpio)         * Suede and Jerry (Libra)         * Terri and Keith (Leo)     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Nina Garcia, Michael Kors     * Guest judge: Francisco Costa

episodes.title: Transformation
episodes.overview: The designers are assigned recent college graduates and are given the task of giving them a fashion makeover to help them enter the workforce. Each designer was to gear their look to their client's specific profession, whilst keeping their style and pleasing both the clients and their mothers. The clients wore the outfits down the runway; the models were not used in this challenge.     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Nina Garcia, Michael Kors     * Guest judge: Cynthia Rowley

episodes.title: Rock n' Runway
episodes.overview: The designers are given the task of designing for each other. The looks were to be inspired by different genres of music. The designers wore their outfits down the runway; the models were not used for this challenge. Teams (Designers names are in bold; genre applies to teammate):         * Jerell designed for Kenley (Pop Music)         * Kenley designed for Leanne (Hip Hop Music)         * Leanne designed for Korto (Country Music)         * Korto designed for Suede (Punk Rock)         * Suede designed for Jerell (Rock and Roll)     * Judges: Heidi Klum, Nina Garcia, Michael Kors     * Guest judge: LL Cool J

episodes.title: Nature Calls
episodes.overview: The remaining contestants head outdoors, to design an outfit of their choice inspired by nature.

episodes.title: Sew Me What You Got
episodes.overview: In the fourth-season opener, the new crop of designers invades New York City. Then, it's pins-and-needles time when the first challenge finds the newbies racing to design whatever they want. Monique Lhuillier serves as guest judge.

episodes.title: I Started Crying
episodes.overview: The contestants are faced with their second challenge which involves a fashion icon.

episodes.title: Fashion Giant
episodes.overview: The remaining designers try to measure up as they begin working for a very different client.

episodes.title: Trendsetter
episodes.overview: The remaining designers must split up into teams to participate in a battle involving major fashion faux pas.

episodes.title: What's the Skinny?
episodes.overview: The remaining designers are in a challenge that involves seamless fashion transformations.

episodes.title: Eye Candy
episodes.overview: The designers choose items from a chocolate shop to make their outfits.

episodes.title: What a Girl Wants
episodes.overview: The remaining designers are asked to create prom dresses for a group of teen girls.

episodes.title: On Garde!
episodes.overview: The designers have to come up with outfits that are based on various hairstyles. Italian fashion designer Alberta Ferretti is the guest judge for the week.

episodes.title: Even Designers Get the Blues
episodes.overview: The remaining designers have to put their own spin on denim fabric.

episodes.title: Raw Talent
episodes.overview: The remaining designers must come up with clothing that are inspired by female professional wrestlers.

episodes.title: The Art of Fashion
episodes.overview: For their last challenge before Fashion Week competition, the designers must make outfits using their own artistic expressions. After the elimination, the final designers return home to work on their signature collection.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.overview: All the Season 4 designers reunite to dish on what really happened during the season.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: The remaining finalists are getting their showcases ready for Fashion Week in Bryant Park in New York City.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: As the fourth season draws to a close, one designer, with the help of Victoria "Posh" Beckham, is finally chosen as the winner of Project Runway.

episodes.title: Road to Runway: Season 3 - Casting Special
episodes.overview: Tim Gunn hosts the behind-the-scenes look at how the third season designers were cast, including bio videos of the designers and a look at how second season contestants are doing with their careers.

episodes.title: Wall to Wall
episodes.overview: The fifteen designers chosen must create a garment only out of the materials located in their apartments.

episodes.title: Fit For A Queen
episodes.overview: The designers were paired into groups and assigned to design and create a gown for Miss U.S.A. (Tara Conner) to wear for the Miss Universe pageant.

episodes.title: Designer's Best Friend
episodes.overview: A visit to Central Park sets the scene in which the designers are informed that they'll be designing an evening outfit based on a story that's been inspired by a tiny dog. The designers must also design outfits for the dogs to wear.

episodes.title: Reap What You Sew
episodes.overview: The remaining designers are asked to design a three piece look that embraces the INC (International Concepts) style and concept. Mehmet Tangoren, Vice President of Contemporary Sportswear for Macy’s guest judges.

episodes.title: Iconic Statement
episodes.overview: The remaining designers face the challenge of modernizing a look for a famous fashion icon.

episodes.title: Waste Not, Want Not
episodes.overview: Each designer is given 30 minutes to fill as many bins as they needed with recyclable materials. From these materials, they must an entire outfit.

episodes.title: Everyday Woman
episodes.overview: With only eight designers remaining, Heidi challenges the crew to make a look for an "everyday woman" with some surprising new models helping them.

episodes.title: High Flying Fashion
episodes.overview: The seven remaining designers have their talents tested when they are told to create an outfit that has a unique purpose.

episodes.title: Couture Du Jour
episodes.overview: With the six designers are in Paris and the challenge is to make a couture gown.

episodes.title: Black and White
episodes.overview: Two surprise guests shake things up for the remaining six contestants as they help them with their latest challenge.

episodes.title: What the Elle?
episodes.overview: All four are going to Fashion Week!

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.overview: The cast of Season 3 reunites to recap all the gripes, drama and other shenanigans which were only seen by those behind the scenes. One of the designers wins the first ever “Fan Favorite” award, along with a check for $10,000. Apparently, even if you don't make it to the final runway show at Bryant Park for Olympus Fashion Week, it still pays to be a personality on the show!

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: Each of the final four designers (Uli, Laura, Michael and Jeffrey) gets a special visit in their hometown from Tim Gunn. It's near the end of their process of completing their 12 designs for the final runway show at Bryant Park, for Olympus Fashion Week in New York City.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: Now we finally get to see all of the final collections from the designers and also find out who the judges will choose as the winner of Project Runway Season Three!

episodes.title: Road to the Runway
episodes.overview: Second season premiere!

episodes.title: Clothes Off Your Back
episodes.overview: Heidi throws a roof-top party for the designers.  At the party, she announces their next challenge: each must create an outfit using nothing besides the clothes he or she has worn to the party.

episodes.title: All Dolled Up
episodes.overview: Tonight the contestants are asked to design for a global star.

episodes.title: Team Lingerie
episodes.overview: The remaining designers must design lingerie for this week's challenge.  The twist is -- they have to do it as teams.

episodes.title: Social Scene
episodes.overview: The remaining designers must each design a dress for a prominent socialite -- Nicky Hilton.  Hilton chooses the winner; the loser is eliminated.

episodes.title: Window Shopping
episodes.overview: The designers that are left put together an ensemble for a famous clothing company, as well as a compelling and successful window display advertising the clothing.

episodes.title: On Thin Ice
episodes.overview: The remaining designer wannabes have to get sporty when they have to create a garment for a professional figure skater.

episodes.title: Inspiration
episodes.overview: The remaining contestants have to try to draw inspiration from their surroundings while outside in New York.

episodes.title: Flower Power
episodes.overview: The remaining designers must design something suitable for a garden party while using things out of a garden.

episodes.title: Makeover
episodes.overview: The designers must design a "make over" look for another designer.

episodes.title: What's Your Line?
episodes.overview: The remaining four contestants face off in the final competition before the final three advance to the Fall Fashion Week finale. They must design an evening gown that will be worn by Iman.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.overview: All the 16 contestants reunite to discuss their personal highs and woes during the various challenges and reflect on just how the show has changed their lives.

episodes.title: Finale (1)
episodes.overview: In Part 1 of the two-part second-season finale, the three remaining designers return to their homes to create the line that will be shown in a face-off at New York Fashion Week. The episode includes a look at the contestants' personal lives as Tim Gunn makes a visit to each home.

episodes.title: Finale (2)
episodes.overview: In the conclusion of the two-part second season finale, the three remaining contestants must compete in a "face-off" at New York Fashion Week, as there lines are presented to the judges and fashion icons. The winner gets $100,000 and a Saturn Sky Roadster.

episodes.title: Innovation
episodes.overview: The 14 hopefuls all meet up in New York and are given their first assignment: Innovation. Taken to a place where they are said to get their materials, the designers are shocked to see it is a grocery store. Back in the workroom, Austin Scarlett is confused about how to make a dress out of his many corn husks. Mario Cadenas on the other hand quickly makes a dress out of a shower curtain and is finished in 10 minutes. At judging, Austin's creativity pays off as he is the winner of the competition, and Daniel Franco is the first designer sent home.

episodes.title: Vision
episodes.overview: Another day begins, and the designers are to design a dress that represents 'Envy'. As they finish, the designers are surprisedly told that their dresses will be put for sale in a private auction, with whomever gets the most bids winning the challenge. At the runway, it is revealed Kara Saun's design earned the most bids, pocketing over $400. As the designers are asked to explain their idea, the judges are not impressed with Mario's simplicity and send him home.

episodes.title: Commercial Appeal
episodes.overview: The designers finally have to decide something actually wearable. For this challenge, the designers must create a party dress that could appeal to Banana Republic's customers. The winner, instead of being granted immunity, will have their dress marketed and sold at select Banana Republic stores. After two horrible weeks with dresses failing to impress the judges, Wendy Pepper finally comes through with a simple black dress with matching capulet and purse. Wendy is thrilled at the prospect of seeing her design for sale in stores.

episodes.title: Collaboration
episodes.overview: Rock singer Sarah Hudson makes a special appearance. All of the designers show them their prospective Rock N' Roll designs and Sarah picks the three whose designs she liked best: Jay, Kevin, and Austin's. Those three are the team leaders and they have to pick two others to be on their team and as a group, they will work on the group leader's design. At judging, Jay's group is safe and Heidi shocks the remaining designers asking them who they think in their group should be 'out'. Austin breaks down crying before saying Vanessa should be out. Vanessa herself admits she should be out as well. Before elimination, Sarah picks Kevin's design as the winner making him safe from elimination the next week. After deliberation, the judges decide to send home Vanessa because she admitted to them she was a weak link.

episodes.title: Model Clients
episodes.overview: The designers learn that their selected model will be their client, and they must design a wedding dress of their model's dreams. At evaluation, the judges feel as though even Austin's dress was horrendous and not at all like a wedding dress, Nora's was too plain and not original.

episodes.title: Making a Splash
episodes.overview: This next assignment goes a direction not yet seen in this competition. The designers will be designing swimsuits that are functional enough to swim in the pool, yet sophisticated enough to wear to a fashion-industry party.

episodes.title: Design a Collection
episodes.overview: As one group, the designers will create a collection, one carrying the theme "the year 2055”. One designer is to lead, taking responsibility for the overall vision, while each designer will sketch and create an outfit of his or her own for the line.

episodes.title: Postal Uniform Challenge
episodes.overview: Instead of another assignment, Heidi gives the five finalists each brown paper packages containing the key to their next challenge, which they are not allowed to open until the next morning.

episodes.title: Design for the Red Carpet
episodes.overview: This week's challenge is to design a dress for the host of Access Hollywood, Nancy O’Dell. Nancy will help judge the runway and wear the winning design on the red carpet at the 2005 Grammy Awards.

episodes.title: Reunion Show
episodes.overview: A special reunion episode, the 12 designers all reunite to talk about what happened behind the scenes on Project Runway. When people are confronted and questions are answered, the fabric starts flying.

episodes.title: Fashion Week
episodes.overview: After months at home to prepare the final moment has come. The final three have their shot to show the world their collections. While the audience watches the models strut their stuff on the runway.

episodes.title: Road to the Runway - Season 12
episodes.overview: The Season 12 designers are introduced.

episodes.title: All-Star Special
episodes.overview: Eight popular designers from past seasons return to compete for $100,000. The clothiers are Daniel Vosovic, Santino Rice, Jeffrey Sebelia, Uli Herzner, Mychael Knight, Chris March, Sweet P and Korto Momolu. Nicole Kidman makes an appearance.

episodes.title: Project Jay
episodes.overview:
Bravo will follow Jay McCarroll, the winner of the first "Project Runway," as he moves to New York and begins to create and market his very own fashion line in the one-hour documentary, "Project Jay."

Bravo will track the life and career of the winner of a competitive reality series, to see just how his life has changed after being crowned the winner. This warts-and-all documentary will follow Jay McCarroll from the point of his win on last season's "Project Runway" through today.

The colorful, witty and unpredictable designer from rural Pennsylvania captured America's attention with his powerful designs and off-the-wall personality. This documentary will be the viewers' chance to catch up with Jay to see what he is really like as he enters the fashion business head on.

episodes.title: Road to the Runway - Season 9
episodes.overview: Tim Gunn hosts the behind-the-scenes look at how the ninth season designers were cast, including bio videos of the designers and a look at how eight season contestants are doing with their careers.

episodes.title: After The Runway 01 Project Drama
episodes.overview: After The Runway will broadcast interviews with each week's eliminated designer and behind-the-scenes bonus features, including "in depth, roundtable debates" with the show's "standout designers" about the episode.

episodes.title: After The Runway 02 Let's Hear It for the Girls
episodes.overview: A post-show roundup featuring interviews and anecdotes.

episodes.title: After The Runway 03 Designers in Stitches
episodes.overview: A post-show review featuring interviews and anecdotes.

episodes.title: After The Runway 04 Tying Up Loose Ends
episodes.overview: A post-show review featuring interviews and anecdotes.

episodes.title: Road to the Runway - Season 10
episodes.overview: Tim Gunn hosts the behind-the-scenes look at how the Tenth season designers were cast, including bio videos of the designers and a look at how Nine season contestants are doing with their careers.

episodes.title: Spotlight: Marchesa
episodes.overview: A behind-the-seams look at Marchesa, a fashion house founded by designers Georgina Chapman and Keren Craig. Halle Berry and Eva Longoria are among those sharing perspective.

episodes.title: Road to the Runway - Season 11
episodes.overview: An introduction to the designers featured in the new Season 11 of Project Runway

episodes.title: Season 12 Reunion Special
episodes.overview: The designers return to reminisce about their experiences on the show.
